snippet: The Heinz case may have involved a side bet in London. | Mary Jo White is trying to allay skepticism ahead of her Senate confirmation hearing. | Bonus pay on Wall St. rose 9% last year. | Andrew Ross Sorkin warns that “shareholder democracy” can...
abstract: The Heinz case may have involved a side bet in London. | Mary Jo White is trying to allay skepticism ahead of her Senate confirmation hearing. | Bonus pay on Wall St. rose 9% last year. | Andrew Ross Sorkin warns that “shareholder democracy” can mask abuses. | Banks fear a court ruling in Argentina’s bond debt.

headline.main: Week in Review: Sizable Pay for the Wall St. Survivors
